channel.title: [FIXED] One variable, two different outputs
channel.description:
Okay, right. So I have my playerName variable. [code=java] public String playerName = null; [/code] It's set inside the run method of my ClientHandler class. [code=java] playerName = inStream.readString(); [/code] But, when accessed from my Player class, it shows the player name.
playerName: hh
But, when accessed from my PlayerUpdate class, it shows up as null and throws the null pointed exception.
playerName: null
Meh, fixed. I just decided to stop PlayerUpdate from extending Player.

item.title: [FIXED] One variable, two different outputs
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

If I make it static then it works.

Nope, thanks for the suggestion but it doesn’t work.

Read full topic

item.title: [FIXED] One variable, two different outputs
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

Okay, right. So I have my playerName variable.

public String playerName = null;

It’s set inside the run method of my ClientHandler class.

playerName = inStream.readString();

But, when accessed from my Player class, it shows the player name.

playerName: hh
But, when accessed from my PlayerUpdate class, it shows up as null and throws the null pointed exception.
playerName: null

Meh, fixed. I just decided to stop PlayerUpdate from extending Player.

Read full topic
